# Learn Compact - LLM Context

> The definitive guide to learning Compact, Midnight's zero-knowledge smart contract language

## What is this site?

Learn Compact is an educational resource teaching the Compact programming language for the Midnight blockchain. It follows the style of "The Rust Programming Language" book and Rustlings exercises.

## Key Topics

- **Compact Language**: Domain-specific language for zero-knowledge smart contracts
- **Midnight Blockchain**: Data-protection blockchain using ZK cryptography
- **Zero-Knowledge Proofs**: Cryptographic proofs that reveal nothing beyond validity

## Content Structure

- `/ch00-introduction.html` - Overview of Compact and Midnight
- `/ch01-getting-started/` - Installation and first contract
- `/ch02-basic-concepts/` - Program structure, pragma, imports
- `/ch03-type-system/` - Primitive types (Boolean, Field, Uint, Bytes)
- `/ch04-compound-types/` - Composite types (Tuples, Vectors, Maybe, Either)
- `/ch05-user-types/` - Structs, Enums, Generics
- `/ch06-circuits/` - Circuit declarations and pure circuits
- `/ch07-witnesses/` - Private inputs from TypeScript
- `/ch08-control-flow/` - Conditionals, loops, assertions
- `/ch09-expressions/` - Operators and expressions
- `/ch10-ledger-state/` - On-chain state management
- `/ch11-disclosure/` - The disclose() function
- `/ch12-stdlib/` - Standard library functions
- `/ch13-modules/` - Code organization
- `/ch14-constructors/` - Contract initialization
- `/ch15-typescript/` - TypeScript integration

## Compact Language Quick Reference

### Primitive Types
- `Boolean` - true/false
- `Field` - ~254-bit integer (ZK native)
- `Uint<n>` - Unsigned integer with n bits (1-256)
- `Bytes<n>` - Fixed-length byte array

### Composite Types
- `[T1, T2, ...]` - Tuple (heterogeneous)
- `Vector<n, T>` - Homogeneous tuple shorthand
- `Maybe<T>` - Optional value (isSome, value)
- `Either<A, B>` - Disjoint union (isLeft, left, right)

### Circuit Declaration
```compact
export circuit name(param: Type): ReturnType {
    // body
}
```

### Ledger State
```compact
ledger {
    counter: Counter;
    data: Map<Bytes<32>, Uint<64>>;
}
```

## Official Documentation

- Midnight Docs: https://docs.midnight.network
- Compact Language Reference: https://docs.midnight.network/develop/reference/compact/lang-ref

## Source Repository

https://github.com/Olanetsoft/learn-compact
